message:
Last night's attack in Damascus, attributed to Israel

Syrian sources identified with the Shiite axis report that the target of the Israeli attack in Damascus was the "State Security School" (of the Syrian Army - AA), near the village of Najaha, and as a result, a three-story building was severely damaged there.
According to these sources, the target of the attack belonged to the Syrian army and not to Iranian elements in Syria.

The Syrian Ministry of Defense officially announced that Israel carried out an airstrike last night at 10:05 PM which resulted in the injury of 8 Syrian soldiers and damage to property.
event_breakdown:
- Last night's attack in Damascus, attributed to Israel
- Israeli attack in Damascus targeted the "State Security School" near the village of Najaha
- Three-story building severely damaged in the attack
- Target of the attack belonged to the Syrian army, not to Iranian elements in Syria
- Israel carried out an airstrike at 10:05 PM, injuring 8 Syrian soldiers and damaging property

message:
After the report of the Bloomberg agency's reporter in Turkey 👆, the Turkish Ministry of Commerce officially announces:

From today, the import of goods from Israel and the export of goods to it will be suspended until all aid can be brought into the Gaza Strip
event_breakdown: - Turkish Ministry of Commerce announces suspension of import and export with Israel

message: Palestinian sources report the death of officer Muhammad Adas, one of the companions of Palestinian Authority Chairman Abu Mazen from the Presidential Guard, as a result of an IDF shot that hit him in the head during the entry of IDF forces into the village of Anbata in the Tulkarm district in the last hour.
event_breakdown:
- Death of officer Muhammad Adas in the village of Anbata, Tulkarm district
- Officer Muhammad Adas was one of the companions of Palestinian Authority Chairman Abu Mazen from the Presidential Guard 
- IDF shot hit officer Adas in the head during the entry of IDF forces into the village

message:
Sources associated with the Syrian opposition report on limited explosions heard in the last half hour in Damascus, the capital of Syria.

According to these sources, the Syrian air defense systems were not activated.

The sources add that an Israeli airstrike was carried out against a military post near the fifth bridge on the road leading to the Damascus border.
event_breakdown:
- Limited explosions heard in Damascus, Syria
- Syrian air defense systems not activated
- Israeli airstrike against a military post near the fifth bridge on the road leading to the Damascus border

message:
Following today's report on the death of Dr. Adnan Albarsh 👆 and another Gazan, in prison in Israel, Hamas, in an official announcement on its behalf, is trying to create symmetry with the Israeli abductees in Gaza and states that "the death of two of our people abducted in the prison of the fascist occupation, under barbaric torture is proof of the heinous war crimes committed by the occupation.. "
Hamas calls on the international community to act immediately and condemn "this Nazi behavior and force Israel to reveal what happened to the thousands of Palestinians kidnapped by Israel and to return them to their families..."
event_breakdown:
- Death of Dr. Adnan Albarsh and another Gazan in prison in Israel
- Hamas official announcement regarding the deaths and calling for international condemnation of Israeli actions

message: Palestinian channels: Settlers threw stones at Palestinian vehicles on Route 60
event_breakdown: - Settlers threw stones at Palestinian vehicles on Route 60

message:
A new organization calling itself the "Ashtar Brigades" - the Islamic resistance in Bahrain, claims to have launched a drone at the "Traknet" company, which deals with vessel traffic, in Eilat.

This is the first time that an organization related to the axis of resistance located in Bahrain accepts responsibility for military action against Israel.

##
Bahrain is signed on the Abraham Accords security agreement with Israel.
event_breakdown:
- The Ashtar Brigades claims to have launched a drone at the "Traknet" company in Eilat, Israel
- This marks the first time an organization related to the axis of resistance in Bahrain has taken military action against Israel
- Bahrain is signed on the Abraham Accords security agreement with Israel

message:
IDF spokesperson:

Earlier today, IDF forces cleared the remains of another surface-to-surface missile that was intercepted in the Nahal Yalim area, near Arad, as part of the Iranian attack that took place last month.

Hazardous materials were cleared out and the evacuation was carried out using a crane (Rio 6x6) by IDF forces, led by the South District of the Home Front Command and together with fire and rescue forces.

The public is requested to act in accordance with the instructions of the Home Front Command when encountering a suspicious object. It is important to emphasize that falls and fragments of interceptions and missles may be dangerous.
Don't touch them, stay away and report finding them to the police hotline 100.
event_breakdown:
- IDF forces cleared the remains of a surface-to-surface missile intercepted in the Nahal Yalim area near Arad
- Evacuation carried out using a crane (Rio 6x6) by IDF forces led by the South District of the Home Front Command
- Hazardous materials were cleared out during the operation
- Public advised to follow instructions of the Home Front Command when encountering suspicious objects
- Emphasis on the potential danger of falls and fragments from missile interceptions
- Urging people not to touch such objects, stay away, and report findings to the police hotline 100

message:
The Palestinian Prisoner's Club:
Dr. Adnan Albarash, head of the Orthopedics Department at Shifa Hospital in Gaza City, who was arrested by IDF forces who raided the hospital compound, died in an Israeli prison.
event_breakdown:

- Dr. Adnan Albarash died in an Israeli prison.

Anti-Israeli, Hamas-supporting students at CUNY drag the American flag across the floor while stepping on it.

Pro-EU protesters (who oppose the law) were dispersed by riot police.

message:
Tulkarm, West Bank: Palestinian media reports that the last night Palestinian Authority's Security Services killed Ahmed Abu Al-Ful, the commander of the "death squads" in the military wing of the Islamic Jihad in Tulkarm.

Hamas and the Islamic Jihad issued proclamations in which they strongly condemned the PA.
Local organizations in Tulkarm called for demonstrations against the Palestinian Authority.

The spokesman for the PA's Security Services presented the its version of the events:

Abu Al-Ful fired at a PA patrol and they returned fire at the source of the shooting.
event_breakdown:
- Tulkarm, West Bank: Palestinian media reports the killing of Ahmed Abu Al-Ful, the commander of the "death squads" in the military wing of the Islamic Jihad in Tulkarm by Palestinian Authority's Security Services.
- Hamas and the Islamic Jihad issue proclamations condemning the PA.
- Local organizations in Tulkarm call for demonstrations against the Palestinian Authority.
- The spokesman for the PA's Security Services presents their version of the events, stating that Abu Al-Ful fired at a PA patrol and they returned fire at the source of the shooting.

message:
The President of Colombia, Gustavo Petro, announced today during a speech in De Bolivar Square, on the occasion of Workers' Day, that starting tomorrow Colombia will sever diplomatic ties with Israel due to the war in Gaza.

##
The Colombian military industry will be less than happy with the announcement...

message:
Following the report yesterday 👆

IDF: For the first time since the beginning of the war: The Erez Crossing has been opened for the entry of humanitarian aid

According to the government directive, and as part of the effort to increase the quantity and routes for humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip, for the first time since the beginning of the war, the IDF, through the Coordination of Government Activities in the Territories (COGAT), opened the Erez Crossing of the Ministry of Defense's Land Crossings Authority today (Wednesday), to allow the entry of humanitarian aid into the Gaza Strip. As part of this effort, after careful security inspection, 30 trucks of humanitarian aid including food and medical supplies for the northern part of the Gaza Strip, arrived from Jordan and entered Gaza today.

The entry of humanitarian aid through the Erez Crossing was made possible after engineering work was carried out in the area by the Engineering Units and additional IDF forces.
event_breakdown:
- Erez Crossing opened for entry of humanitarian aid into Gaza Strip
- 30 trucks of humanitarian aid including food and medical supplies arrived from Jordan to Gaza

message:
Pro-Palestinian students yesterday took down the American flag at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and raised the Palestinian flag in its place.
County police officers arrived at the scene and re-raised the American flag. The pro-Israeli students stood there with Israeli flags and sang the American national anthem (as you can see in the attached video) in front of the American flag that was raised at the top of the mast.

Immediately after that, the pro-Palestinians tried to remove the American flag again, and then the students in the picture came and raised the American flag and prevented the flag from touching the floor.

##
The Americans are very sensitive to the issue of the flag and in my opinion the pro-Palestinians' injury to it plays against them in American public opinion. The pro-Israel American students made sure to show their respect for American symbols. There are many merits here for Israel and the Jewish community.
location: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
event_breakdown:
- Pro-Palestinian students take down American flag and raise Palestinian flag at University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
- County police officers re-raise American flag
- Pro-Israeli students stand with Israeli flags and sing American national anthem
- Pro-Palestinians attempt to remove American flag again, but students prevent flag from touching the floor

message:
Hezbollah announces a death in its ranks:

Vahid Tefili, born in 2000 from the village of Deir al-Zahrani in southern Lebanon.

Vahid was seriously injured more than four days ago and died tonight from his wounds. The circumstances of his death are not specified.
In addition to being a Hezbollah military operative, he was a "commander" in the local Hezbollah scout tribe.

Number 291

message: It is important to emphasize: as written in the title above 👆, this is the proposal that Israel allegedly forwarded to Hamas. That is, if the report is true, then Israel has agreed to these terms and Hamas has not yet...
event_breakdown:
1. Israel proposed a ceasefire to Hamas.
2. The proposal includes terms such as expanding the fishing zone off the Gaza coast, allowing more imports into Gaza, and easing restrictions on the entry of goods through the Kerem Shalom crossing.
3. Israel's proposal also reportedly includes a plan for improving infrastructure in Gaza, including projects related to water and electricity.
4. If the report is accurate, Israel has agreed to these terms while Hamas has not yet responded.

message:
The Lebanese Al-Akhbar newspaper (affiliated with Hezbollah) publishes the details of the Israeli proposal that it claims was submitted to Hamas through Egypt on April 26:

First stage (40 days - subject to extension)

The Israeli forces will withdraw from the densely populated areas (not from Netzarim Corridor).
Aircraft traffic in the Gaza Strip will be suspended for 8-10 hours every day.
The displaced citizens will be able to return to their homes.
On the seventh day after the release of the women among the abductees, IDF forces will clear the coastal axis to allow the movement of humanitarian aid.
On the 22nd, after the release of two-thirds of the agreed upon hostages, the IDF forces will withdraw from Netzarim Corridor. At this stage, it will be possible to bring in 500 aid trucks a day, 50 of which will be diesel for the operation of the power plant in Gaza. Heavy equipment will also be brought into the Gaza Strip to clear the rubble and the hospitals, clinics will be retrained and the bakeries all over the strip.

During this period, Hamas will release at least 33 abductees under the category: women, children up to the age of 19, adults over the age of 50, sick and wounded.
Israel will release 20 Palestinian prisoners for each abductee, in a matching category: women and children for women and children. Adults against adults, when the proportion of 20 prisoners is kept for each abductee.
In this category, Palestinian prisoners whose remaining sentence exceeds 10 years will not be released.

Soldiers category:
For each kidnapped female soldier, 20 prisoners sentenced to life imprisonment and another 20 prisoners with up to 10 years remaining in prison will be released. Israel has the right to veto the names of the prisoners up to 200 names cumulatively.
The prisoners will be released to the Gaza Strip or abroad.

Rate of release: Hamas will release 3 Israeli hostages every 3 days.
The Palestinian prisoners who will be released will not be able to be re-arrested for the crimes they committed before their prison term (ie they will receive amnesty).

Starting on the 14th, there was an agreement for more wounded military operatives, according to an agreed list, to go through the Rafah crossing for medical treatment abroad.

Second stage of the agreement (42 days)

The completion of the agreement for a comprehensive calm (ceasefire) and its announcement before the release of surviving abductees (men and soldiers) in exchange for the release of additional Palestinian prisoners.
The beginning of the necessary arrangements for the total rehabilitation of the strip.

Step 3 of the agreement (42 days)
Kidnapped-prisoner body swap.
Beginning of the implementation of a 5-year rehabilitation plan for the Strip.
event_breakdown:
1. Lebanese Al-Akhbar newspaper publishes Israeli proposal details submitted to Hamas through Egypt on April 26:
    - First stage of the proposal (40 days):
        - Israeli forces to withdraw from densely populated areas (excluding Netzarim Corridor).
        - Aircraft traffic in Gaza to be suspended for 8-10 hours daily.
        - Displaced citizens allowed to return home.
        - IDF to clear coastal axis after release of women abductees.
        - IDF to withdraw from Netzarim Corridor after release of two-thirds of hostages, allowing aid trucks and heavy equipment into Gaza.
        - Hamas to release specified categories of abductees, with Israel releasing 20 Palestinian prisoners per abductee.

    - Agreement for wounded military operatives to receive medical treatment abroad.

    - Second stage of agreement (42 days):
        - Comprehensive ceasefire before release of remaining abductees, followed by release of more Palestinian prisoners.
        - Beginning of arrangements for total rehabilitation of the Strip.

    - Step 3 of agreement (42 days):
        - Kidnapped-prisoner body swap.
        - Implementation of a 5-year rehabilitation plan for the Strip.

message:
The operation in Rafah - the Lebanese Al-Akhbar newspaper (Hezbollah-affiliated) from its sources:

The US demands that Israel evacuate at least 800,000 displaced people from Rafah before the attack in the area. 40,000 tents arrived in Israel from China, paid for by the United Arab Emirates. Each tent can accommodate 20 people (a total of 800,000 people).

There is a concentration of about a thousand IDF vehicles, including tanks and APCs in the southern area of ​​the Gaza Strip (on the Israeli side).
Israel is planning to break into Rafah from the area of ​​the Sofa crossing and the Kerem Shalom crossing.

The Egyptians asked to check with the leadership of Hamas, whether its military arm is planning to blow up the fences in the border area with Egypt in order to cause crowds to flee to Egyptian territory.
event_breakdown:
1. Rafah, Gaza Strip: The Lebanese Al-Akhbar newspaper reports that the US demands Israel evacuate at least 800,000 displaced people from Rafah before an attack in the area.

2. Israel: 40,000 tents arrive from China, paid for by the United Arab Emirates. Each tent can accommodate 20 people, for a total of 800,000 people.

3. Southern Gaza Strip (on the Israeli side): There is a concentration of about a thousand IDF vehicles, including tanks and APCs.

4. Rafah: Israel is planning to break into Rafah from the Sofa crossing and the Kerem Shalom crossing.

5. Egypt: Egyptians asked to check with the leadership of Hamas if its military arm plans to blow up the fences in the border area with Egypt, which could cause crowds to flee to Egyptian territory.
